alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Monona; Pottawattamie; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 02 at 10:20AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: .Areas of far eastern Nebraska and western Iowa received substantial rains this mornings. It is likely there are many areas with standing water, potentially covering roads. Please use caution when driving in these areas, especially on unpaved roads. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Iowa, including the following counties, Harrison, Monona, Pottawattamie and Shelby. Portions of east central Nebraska, including the following counties, Burt, Dodge and Washington. * WHEN...Until 315 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1018 AM CDT, the public reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blair, Tekamah, Missouri Valley, Logan, Woodbine, Arlington, Fort Calhoun, Mondamin, Kennard, Persia, Modale, Herman, Pisgah, Craig, Magnolia, Little Sioux, Portsmouth, Tennant, Desoto Bend National Wildlife Refuge and Wilson Island State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
